title: PoW header downloader sometime doesn't print any logs

labels.name: status:in-progress
labels.description: Actively being worked on (picked up by developer)

body:
Example (BSC): it did print after 40sec, and then only after 5min.
```
[INFO] [09-26|02:55:18.651] [2/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=21003508 blk/second=76.800 alloc=3.6GB sys=4.4GB
[INFO] [09-26|02:55:58.651] [2/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=21006580 blk/second=153.600 alloc=4.1GB sys=4.4GB
[INFO] [09-26|02:56:32.985] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=80
[INFO] [09-26|02:58:32.985] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=79
[INFO] [09-26|03:00:32.985] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=81
[INFO] [09-26|03:01:18.651] [2/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=21015796 blk/second=460.800 alloc=3.7GB sys=4.8GB
```

It's because of non-stop signaling to `cfg.hd.DeliveryNotify`:
```
[TRACE] [09-26|04:33:37.060] headerLoop woken up by the incoming request
[TRACE] [09-26|04:33:37.094] headerLoop woken up by the incoming request
```

@AlexeyAkhunov is it expected notification frequency? is it expected headerLoop iterations frequency?
